alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Juneau (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 12 at 3:48PM AKDT until October 13 at 4:00PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM AKDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...The following area, The Mendenhall Valley including Mendenhall Lake and River, Auke Lake, Montana Creek, and Jordan Creek. * WHEN...Until 700 AM AKDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Possible isolated landslides in areas of steep terrain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 348 PM AKDT, satellite estimates indicate heavy rain across the advisory area. Rapid river rises will cause minor flooding, especially near Mendenhall Lake and River, Montana Creek, Auke Lake and Jordan Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 3 to 5 inches are possible. - For Auke Lake near Auke Bay: At 3:00pm the stage was 31.34 feet. Flood Stage is 33.0 feet. - For Jordan Creek near Juneau: At 3:00pm the stage was 7.89 feet. Flood Stage is 9.7 feet. Forecast: A crest around 10.4 feet is expected around 4:00pm Thursday. - For Montana Creek at Back Loop Bridge: At 3:00pm the stage was 11.92 feet. Flood Stage is 15.5 feet. Forecast: A crest around 15.09 feet is expected around 4:00pm Thursday. - For Mendenhall Lake : At 3:15pm the stage was 5.34 feet. Flood Stage is 9.0 feet. Forecast: A crest around 9.74 feet is expected around 4:00am Friday.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
